openerSection: The Premier Mastercard credit card is an exclusive offering by HSBC for its customers who maintain the Premier relationship with the bank in India. As is obvious from the name, the card is powered by MasterCard and is complimentary for the Premier customers of the bank. As introductory benefits, the customers can get complimentary Taj Epicure membership and a free night stay at taj hotels. The card earns you Reward Points at a decent reward rate that are redeemable against various products and airline miles.

You also get many other travel, dining, and lifestyle benefits, such as complimentary airport lounge access, free golf sessions, etc. We have discussed in detail all the features and benefits that come bundled with this card in this article. Read on to learn more about this Premier exclusive offering by HSBC.
andThereIsMore: This card is exclusive for HSBC Premier Relationship customers.
2 Reward Points for every Rs. 100 spent using the card.
Reward Points transferable to partner airlines' AirMiles programs and hotel loyalty programs.
Reward Points redeemable for products, shopping vouchers, etc on the bank's rewards catalog.
Lower than usual foreign currency mark-up of 1.99%.
Fuel surcharge waiver at all fuel stations across India.
Zero cost liability protection post the time of reporting the loss of card.
Emergency services and travel insurance benefits.
Complimentary rounds of golf and discounted fee at select golf courses across India.
Learning offers with partners including British Council, Yousician, eDX.

Domestic Lounge Access: 6 complimentary domestic airport lounge access under the MasterCard Lounge program
International Lounge Access: LoungeKey membership with 2 complimentary international lounge visits per year
Insurance Benefits: Emergency services and international travel insurance
Zero Liability Protection: Credit cardholders will not be held liable for any fraudulent transaction that takes place through their card post the reporting of loss or theft of the card to the bank.

Cash Advance Charge: Rs. 300 or 2.5% of the amount withdrawn, whichever is higher.
